Posted By: Galgus (4/10/2012 9:17:14 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
All cool cards should be playable at the very least. I understand the need for bad cards, but why can't they all be simple? It's only going to be used by new players who don't have enough cards that they can replace it, anyway, so they won't mind bad cards being simple.  
  
This card being so bad is just wasted potential. The effect is cool, but not only does the cost actively discouraging anyone with enough cards from using it, it also makes it hard to play it as intended even if you're willing to use it anyway. Who's going to have enough mana to use this over and over? A thousand stings would cost 5000 mana, after all. Make it cost B, THEN it could be used as the flavor suggests.
posts.html:
All cool cards should be playable at the very least. I understand the need for bad cards, but why can't they all be simple? It's only going to be used by new players who don't have enough cards that they can replace it, anyway, so they won't mind bad cards being simple.

This card being so bad is just wasted potential. The effect is cool, but not only does the cost actively discouraging anyone with enough cards from using it, it also makes it hard to play it as intended even if you're willing to use it anyway. Who's going to have enough mana to use this over and over? A thousand stings would cost 5000 mana, after all. Make it cost B, THEN it could be used as the flavor suggests.

posts.post_content: @Velacteis - Your scenario is highly situational and would work just as well with many other cards - or simply without this card in the same context. Comparing this to [Join the Ranks](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Join the Ranks) - a card made for a specific tribe - is a terrible comparison. This card does not have a tribe or scenario in which is excels like Join the Ranks (despite your attempts to create such a scenario). This card does not "sweeten" any other cards simply because it recurs on its own *sometimes*. You failed to mention in your scenario about how you achieved and maintain a larger hand than all your opponents. This is not worth ![4](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=4&type=symbol)![Black](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=B&type=symbol) just because it is an arcane, nor is it worth ![4](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=4&type=symbol)![Black](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=B&type=symbol) because it recurs automatically. It is not worth ![4](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=4&type=symbol)![Black](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=B&type=symbol), at all. **SleetFox** is completely correct with his analysis, while you are overcompensating for a card that is not worth it. It has a cool name, and a cool picture. That's all it has going for it.

This is not worth just because it is an arcane, nor is it worth because it recurs automatically. It is not worth , at all. posts.post_content:
If this cost ![Black](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=B&type=symbol), it would be competitively viable, especially because it recurs.  
If it cost ![1](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=1&type=symbol)![Black](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=B&type=symbol), it could be a good card in Limited.  
If it cost ![2](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=2&type=symbol)![Black](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=B&type=symbol), it might see a little casual action.  
If it cost ![3](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=3&type=symbol)![Black](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=B&type=symbol), it would be largely forgettable.  
But no. Instead, it costs ![4](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=4&type=symbol)![Black](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=B&type=symbol), and it's now known as one of the worst cards in the game. Well done, Wizards, for printing this mistake. Sometimes bad cards need to be made just to show us how good the good ones are. For comparison, in the very next set, [Lightning Helix](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Lightning Helix) was printed, which did 3 times as much for ![Red](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=R&type=symbol)![White](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=W&type=symbol). No recursion, but it was still much better.
posts.html:

If it cost , it would be largely forgettable.
But no. Instead, it costs , and it's now known as one of the worst cards in the game. Well done, Wizards, for printing this mistake. Sometimes bad cards need to be made just to show us how good the good ones are. For comparison, in the very next set, Lightning Helix was printed, which did 3 times as much for . No recursion, but it was still much better.
